page.title: 17Laceby Acres-the classroom
page.content: At school you keep all of you necessary school belongings in a tray. This measures 35 x 25 x 7cm.You keep books in it such as reading books,text books and exercise books.Other objects you keep in your tray are,lined backing sheet,pens and coloured pencils,rulers,rubbers,occasionally calculators,compasses,protractors and pencil sharpeners.Coloured pencils are usually kept in a bag or a box.Dictionarys can be kept in you tray but usually kept on a shelf in the classroom.Trays are stacked in a wooden trolley overnight.Another form of storage is the desk.The desk holds about 5/6 times more than the tray.It's lid lifts up so you keep all your school things in there.You sit at your desk for lessons.Some schools dont have trays or desks.Children carry their bags around school.
